definition: to sit and watch, but remain indifferent (idiom)
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
(negative prefix)/not/no
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: We're not going to sit by and let that kind of behaviour take place in control towers.
sentences.chinese: 我们不会坐视不理，让类似情况在控制管中再发生。

sentences.english: People sat by idly and remained indifferent to the theft on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 面对公交车上的偷盗行为，大家都坐视不理。

sentences.english: If they started looking like insurrection would happen, the Romans didn't do it.
sentences.chinese: 如果叛乱要发生了，罗马人不会坐视不理。

definition: to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
not to get involved/to stay out of it
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
excessively tolerant/to overindulge (sb)/overly conciliatory/to seek appeasement at any price
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to shield/to harbor/to cover up
to get involved in/to meddle/interference
to ignore/to let alone/to indulge
powerless to defend oneself (idiom); helpless
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
resolute/definitive/categorically/absolutely
to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in
